message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Please track the performance of political parties labelled as far-right in the United Kingdom, France, and Germany in all presidential (first round) elections held from 2010 through 2024 (including 2024). For each election, record the following details: Year, Country, Party, Party President during the election (if the party does not has a pressent, record the leader(s)/chairman), Popular Vote (number of votes won by the party or its presidential candidate), Vote Share (%, to keep one digit), Winning Party / bloc (overall victor of the election)

Please output the organized data in the format of one Markdown table.
The column names in the table are as follows in sequence:
Year, Country, Party, Party President, Popular Vote, Vote Share(%), Winning Party/ Bloc

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
We need to gather data on far-right parties' performance in presidential elections across three countries from 2010 to 2024. We'll start by identifying the relevant parties and their leaders for each country.
</think>

<search> far-right political parties UK 2010-2024 </search>

Search query: far-right political parties UK 2010-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Far-right_politics_in_the_United_Kingdom):
Far-right politics in the United Kingdom - Wikipedia Far-right politics are a recurring phenomenon in the United Kingdom since the early 20th century, with the formation of Nazi, fascist, antisemitic, ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_political_parties_in_the_United_Kingdom):
List of political parties in the United Kingdom - Wikipedia The Electoral Commission's Register of Political Parties lists the details of political parties registered to contest elections in the United Kingdom, ...

[Doc 3](https://academic.oup.com/pa/article/77/4/816/7733071):
Instability, crisis, and statecraft in Conservative Britain, 2010–24 Abstract. This article examines how the Conservative Party dominated British politics from 2010 to 2024 despite this period being one of ...

Search query: far-right political parties France 2010-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_political_parties_in_France):
List of political parties in France - Wikipedia This article contains a list of political parties in France. France has a multi-party political system: one in which the number of competing political ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Rally):
National Rally - Wikipedia The National Rally known as the National Front from 1972 to 2018 is a French far-right political party, described as right-wing populist and nationalist.

[Doc 3](https://www.statista.com/topics/9604/far-right-politics-in-france-2022/?srsltid=AfmBOop-M1t1lzLlOTfvRbvIModxS5y8RWCv7ZrNJWgPafr2JeLhzlg_):
Far-right politics in France - statistics & facts - Statista On January 7th, 2025, Jean-Marie Le Pen, the historic founder of the Rassemblement National (formerly known as the Front National) far-right party, ...

Search query: far-right political parties Germany 2010-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Far-right_politics_in_Germany_(1945%E2%80%93present)):
Far-right politics in Germany (1945–present) - Wikipedia The far-right in Germany (German: rechtsextrem) slowly reorganised itself after the fall of Nazi Germany and the dissolution and subsequent ban of the Nazi ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_political_parties_in_Germany):
List of political parties in Germany - Wikipedia The Federal Republic of Germany has a plural multi-party system. Historically, the largest by members and parliament seats are the Christian Democratic ...

[Doc 3](https://theconversation.com/a-far-right-political-group-is-gaining-popularity-in-germany-but-so-too-are-protests-against-it-223151):
A far-right political group is gaining popularity in Germany – but so ... What has driven so many Germans to suddenly protest against a small, extremist political party? The protesters in Germany are directly ...

Based on these searches, I identify the relevant parties:
- UK: UKIP (UK Independence Party)
- France: National Rally (formerly FN - Front National)
- Germany: AfD (Alternative für Deutschland)

Now let’s gather their performance data for presidential elections.
</think>

<search> UKIP performance in UK presidential elections 2010-2024 </search>

Search query: UKIP performance in UK presidential elections 2010-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2010_United_Kingdom_general_election):
2010 United Kingdom general election - Wikipedia A general election was held in the United Kingdom on Thursday 6 May 2010, to elect 650 Members of Parliament (or MPs) to the House of Commons.

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UK_Independence_Party_representation_and_election_results):
UK Independence Party representation and election results This article lists the election results and representation of the UK Independence Party (UKIP) with respect to the House of Commons, Scottish Parliament, ...

[Doc 3](https://nhsjs.com/2025/prosperity-austerity-and-immigration-an-empirical-study-of-the-regional-drivers-of-populisms-growth-in-the-uk-2010-2024/):
Prosperity, Austerity, and Immigration: An Empirical Study of the ... Over the last 15 years, support for UK populist parties — UKIP and later Reform UK —has risen significantly. While voter surveys often point ...

Search query: National Rally performance in France 2010-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Rally):
National Rally - Wikipedia The National Rally known as the National Front from 1972 to 2018 is a French far-right political party, described as right-wing populist and nationalist.

[Doc 2](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1313172/votes-cast-rassemblement-national-french-legislative-elections-round/?srsltid=AfmBOop57kw6c5LfSUjhkpzMpoMDaZItTp8HhGjDFHZyyB-Zxjd6Wkjt):
Legislative election: National Rally votes in France 2024 - Statista In France, legislative elections determine the representatives sitting in the lower chamber of Parliament, known as the National Assembly.

[Doc 3](https://www.economist.com/briefing/2025/12/11/once-a-pariah-the-national-rally-is-now-frances-most-popular-party):
Once a pariah, the National Rally is now France's most popular party Two giggling teens are poring over a selfie they took with Jordan Bardella, after a five-hour wait in the southern French town of Perpignan.
<search> AfD performance in German presidential elections 2010-2024 </search>

Search query: AfD performance in German presidential elections 2010-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.wilsoncenter.org/article/germanys-far-right-afd-doubles-vote-share-and-reshapes-germanys-political-landscape):
Germany's Far-right AfD Doubles Vote Share and Reshapes ... ... political landscape. While the AfD has no path to government, its growing influence is poised to reshape German politics. These results ...

[Doc 2](https://www.statista.com/chart/33964/afds-share-of-the-vote-in-recent-and-upcoming-elections/?srsltid=AfmBOoo_zQZN2uKwrIuvWOSH32Z5m4yVmGWrG1bn3Iy-4jUhRbwVrSnm):
Chart: The Rise of Germany's Far-Right AfD | Statista This chart shows the AfD's share of the vote in recent and upcoming German federal elections.

[Doc 3](https://theconversation.com/far-right-afd-makes-unprecedented-election-gains-in-west-germany-worrying-national-government-215647):
Far-right AfD makes unprecedented election gains in west Germany ... Gains in Bavaria and Hesse mark new territory for a radical-right party that once only really enjoyed support in one region.
